title: You did it riot, you made me put away my wallet to your business.
body:
This season has honestly made me question "why am I even playing?" more than ever. I love your game so much but from the balances to dynamic queue, I just can't see the point in purchasing any more RP.  I like an even playing field, but this season just isn't cutting the mustard.  I finally reached my promo after a constant grind where I split the first two games.  What do I get next?  I queue in a game only to get absolutely destroyed in my third game.  I'm far from a good player, but I know I can handle myself fairly well in Silver  even when losing, I'm not too far behind my laner.  Being completely outclassed by this Yasuo and seeing how good he was vs my teammates made me think something was up.  Looking up his match history, he has gone 17-3 in his last 20.  I know streaks happen, but I just find this one fishy.   Even if it legit, I can't but help think that dynamic queue has made this hard for a solo player to climb.  I work 40 hours a week, so I don't typically have a duo or trio to regularly queue with.

I know I'm not smart enough to quit league all together because of that addicting pull it has on me, but I don't see the rank climb worth it anymore.  I love my Gold morgana skin, but at this point it's just not fun to even try.  As someone mentioned in a previous post, DQ feels like a form of boosting that you seem to be okay with.

I know in the grand scheme of things, my wallet won't dent your revenue, but for someone who spends more on here than the average player, I hope it is a wakeup call.

Keep trying to improve you game, I really don't want to quit altogether.

replies.body: It's not even about being unable to climb. It's that the system mixes all queue configurations into a unified ranking which is a poor indicator for any individual configuration and leads to an inability to fairly assess players' skill based on rankings in a consistent environment. A Gold 1 with only solo games reflects different skills than another Gold 1 (even in the same role and on the same champion) who only plays with his three other friends.

yeahh!

Gold 1 soloQ is like Gold 1 

Gold 1 dynQ is like Bronze 1 !

This sounds like a fixable problem - just tighten up the players' division reaches. +1/-1 division higher or lower than them.
Like they did for Masters and Challengers.

> [{quoted}](name=Elikain,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AEKLAtUH,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2016-04-10T20:00:26.189+0000)
>
> This sounds like a fixable problem - just tighten up the players' division reaches. +1/-1 division higher or lower than them.
> Like they did for Masters and Challengers.

I'd love it if they brought back ranked teams, I used to have a team with my diamond friend, a gold friend and a silver friends, with me being plat. I really cba to grind up 'soloqueue' in order to play ranked 5's again, and with restrictions getting stricter it's only getting worse.

To be fair, +1/-1 division of each other is fair for starters.
So if a Silver player wants to play ranked, his choices of friends extend from Gold 1-5 to Bronze 1-5.
However, i don't think that all players in that premade should get their own reach as well. If that were the case:

Bronze can Invite Bronze and Silver
Silver can Invite Bronze-Gold
Gold can invite Silver-Plat
Plat can Invite Gold-Diamond

So we're back to Bronze-Silver-Gold-Plat-Diamond, which is again 5 divisions in one premade, vastly different skill levels and still not balanced. You could choose which players' reach you should go for by having them being premade team captains, which means only their reach is applied to the entire premade.
So, this new combination would work like this:

Gold player is the reaching player, he can invite Silver, Gold and Plat players. Every other player is limited to the same invite reach.

Actually the way it currently works (so people have said) is that you can invite large gaps (as silver I can invite gold and bronze) but once one accepts, the player 2 away automatically declines bc they cannot be part of the group anymore. IE If a gold player invites silver and plat players, the plat player cannot join after the silver bc the silver player could not invite the plat player and the game won't pair them. Then again, I never used voice chat when I grouped w/ anyone (unless yelling down the hall to my roommate counts when I played w/ my college roommate) so I just stopped grouping this season bc it would fuck me since opponents would all be on voice coms and I wouldn't.

Unless I am massively missing something this is how it already is. It doesn't let me play with my gold friend just because my plat friend is in the game also. That, or we have been doing something wrong all this time.

Looking at the yasuo you went up against he is very likely a yasuo main boosting his low tier friend. He went from a consistant win/loss ratio with Garen and a few other champs then he suddenly switches to yasuo everygame and starts carying mostly every game for wins.

Agreed. If you look deeper you can see a loss pattern.  He loses roughly 4 games in a row before he breaks the streak only to repeat it.  I can only assume he is trying to keep his rank mmr close to his friends.  Riot made elo boosting quite easy nowadays!

http://imgur.com/E0iqNM1

yea he's definitely a smurf
So you got stomped by a climbing Yasuo smurf? Ok? It happens, it sucks, but soon he'll be placed higher and at his own skill level.

Yea I know it happens but I don't think he'll be placed at his own skill level.  Again he did go 17-3 in his last 20 games but upon further looking on gg.op, he has a pattern of 4 losses followed by 1 win and it repeats.  It's clear he's keeping it there to help other friends lol.

I remember when climbing out of Silver, I was placed against people who were in Platinum last season. That seems really .. really unfair, even if said people were on my team- it'd still tick me off because how can people outplay a Platinum player even if they'r no longer in Plat? Seems like the Ranking system is truly unbalanced and an elo boost for friends man.

plat players don't have any automatic boosts to their damage or anything like that. It's totally possible to outplay someone higher ranked than you (unless they are like high diamond+ and are super good).

If the gap between plat and silver is so small that they have a similar impact on the game even half the time then there is something wrong w/ the ranking system (assuming players are not boosted and smurfing respectively).

Maybe mechanical difference can be greater in a lower ranked player but total game skill should be a large gap if we are talking about multiple tiers of separation (ie it's not even silver vs gold, but silver vs plat, or diamond vs challenger, there is a whole tier of players in between that are supposed to have skill that is BETWEEN those two ranks). I remember a long time back I was in a ranked game and someone raged about how shit I was and his buddy would stomp me 1v1 bla bla bla. I needed mechanics practice so I said I'd play against his friend if he wanted to, and it was so far back it was just customs on SR instead of the 1v1 mode they made. I screwed up an engage and had first death, but the guy said he thought you played it out when I said he won, so I just manipulated side waves and out rotated/out farmed him and after the 3rd unanswered tower he apologized for his friend being a jerk and added me to his friends list so he could help me w/ mechanics and laning and I could help him learn better rotations and push strats. Just bc someone doesn't have the mechanics, doesn't mean they have the same impact. I've played vs higher ranked players that I can hold my own w/, but consistently they are in the right place at the time I'm identifying that it is the right place and showing up to a skirmish a couple seconds early is a huge advantage for their team.

to be honest, i'm a plat toplaner that a silver league player would not want to have on his team as a jungler due to how bad at it I am...
there is a big difference between your main role and your worst role, especially at plat-low diamond level where most of us one trick ponies reside :D

Well yeah, but I'm assuming this is ranked and you're in your primary role. If you're not a plat level player overall and are a plat level yorick one trick or something then you aren't a plat player if you're not on yorick. If I'm in normals I'm probably playing stuff I'm bronze level at half the time.
when I did my placements in silver in season 4... my first game was against a Diamond5 player... fun times

Make better decisions, know where to be at the right time,  be aware of your surroundings, learn to synergize with whatever team you have, keep your composure and above all remain positive even when the going gets tough.

Look man you just gotta keep improving and through time you will make less mistakes and climb the ranks!  Its perfectly normal to make mistakes in games, LCS pros do it all the time! But learning to adapt is key. Many players I see lose their cool over a few mistakes they make or their team makes and then fail to recuperate. Also, stop blaming Dynamic Queue.

> [{quoted}](name=czo0p,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AEKLAtUH,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-04-10T09:07:48.690+0000)
>

> Look man you just gotta keep improving and through time you will make less mistakes and climb the ranks!  Its perfectly normal to make mistakes in games, LCS pros do it all the time! But learning to adapt is key. Many players I see lose their cool over a few mistakes they make or their team makes and then fail to recuperate. Also, stop blaming Dynamic Queue.

And I do agree with a lot you say.  Even in losses, I still try to find out things I've done well and things I could have improved.  I was the one that let the Yasuo get big.  Games like this are not going to make me quit league.  Still there isn't much I can do for my teammates and I can put some of the blame there on Dynamic Queue.  I can do that because most games for solo players do come down to whoever has the best premade.  Furthermore, if the enemy premade contains a jungler, their odds increase.  You can be fully aware until you're blue in the face, but if a solo player is the jungler and the enemy trio of mid, top, and jungler are there to contest every blue while your team don't even bat an eye, there's not much you can do.

If a trio ganks top lane for a 4 man gank(and I've seen this many times) while your mid and bot continue to last hit instead of trading towers or rotating, there's not much you can do.  Despite my name, I can keep cool and I'm not afraid to hit that mute button.  Sorry but some of these teams can't be synergized with when they have the ARAM mentality.

I play a lot of different games that leads to a pretty universal way of getting better.

"What did I do wrong to lose there?"

I ask myself that all the time. In my last 6 or 7 games I find myself without answers. Sure, the responses I get will probably speculate and offer advice that I don't need, but this season is really about hoping people don't let a snowball happen.

It's a weird combination of the entire game feeling snowbally and playing against small groups of players that understand how to make the snowball work for them, and at the end of the game you're just left thinking "Wow. Not much I can do by myself to stop it." I completely understand where you're coming from, but a lot of people just don't get it.

Im so surprised I got that many down votes for being optimistic and talking about improving in the game. Those people are the problem with this game! They are the ones on your team who will fail to recuperate, fail to become better, and fail to "bat an eye" They dont improve!

Look tbh... I get the problem with Dynamic Queue I just said to stop blaming it cause complaining aint going to do shit for the time being except make you feel "inferior" to those premades! Just look in becoming better and mastering the game.

If you really believe the best premade wins... Then why dont you just team up with other players? There problem solved.

This is the way I see it ( not saying this is you exactly just an example ) 

Your **rank** is silver, your** skill** level is silver, your **mentality** is silver.

Even if your rank doesn't change your skill and mentality can!  That's what truly counts at the end of the day!

Sorry you got downvoted so much.  My post to you wasn't an attack post.  I was just simply stating that many of the games are decided because of DQ.  I understand I can improve and I'm trying, but lets be fair that it's hard as a solo queue in a DQ world(especially when others are boosting multiple people)

Again, this isn't a "I deserve to be gold but muh teammates" post, I'm just trying to point out that there are some very clear flaws to DQ and the way its currently run.  

I also stated that I work often so I don't get too many game in.  It's hard to find a solid group of pre-mades when you're working a lot.  Furthermore, my friends(all but 2) have quit league all together.  Now we're trying to find some strangers online with similar time zones to play some coordinated matches.  Not saying impossible, but its also not easy especially when my free time doesn't match with others.

Its totally fine lol, I actually laughed at it!  Keep them coming!!!! I hope it can garner 100+ downvotes.  Im just trying to be optimistic and improve your experience. DQ has only be around for 3 months and will be around for awhile and it doesnt seem they have any changes planned.

I hope everyone gets what they are looking for from Riot. Kappa

Can't tell you how many times I get shitted on by TEAMMATES because they are premade and despite their billion mistakes they made that I've tolerated and let slide and haven't said anything about; I make one mistake and they unleash all hell on me. Fuck dynamic queue. Fuck anyone who defends dynamic queue being shoved down our throats. You guys ruined ranked. Dynamic queue rank only benefits people in bronze or silver and quite frankly in the world of competitive gaming, the bottom of the barrel really doesn't matter. Neither do my elo or rank as we all suck but dynamic queue starts to hurt at this elo a lot more than lower elo.
upvoted for "isn't cutting the mustard"

> I know I'm not smart enough to quit league all together because of that addicting pull it has on me, but I don't see the rank climb worth it anymore

At this point it feels to me that a lot of Solo Q players are just waiting to see what happens and Riot is scared to make the actual announcement because with games like Overwatch and Dark Souls 3 coming out they know with a true "no Solo Q" announcement that many people who are just waiting to see will jump ship.

On the bright side, this is the thing that will eventually ween you off League.
I have it preordered already.  I'm hoping it becomes a good game.  I luckily have the cpu to run it on the highest settings.
Wait, so you don't want to give Rito your money because you are getting beaten in ranked?
He actually doesn't want to give Riot his hard earned cash due to insanely bad balancing situations, both game-balance wise and ranked-wise.

Really?  Beccause it looks like he is whining about a really good Yasuo kicking his ass instead of figuring out what Yasuo is doing to kicck his ass.

And then somehow randomly believes being in a duo makes you a better player.

You're missing the point, but I'll try to be less confusing.  I figured out what he's doing to kick ass.  He's boosting friends with his Yasuo's 84 win percentage.  After that he goes on losing streaks to keep himself in that mmr.  It's about the system's imbalance(which I am crediting riot has been tweaking and working hard on), and the fact that one person who is clearly ranks ahead queuing with 2 other people helping them move up to rank.  It shows how imbalanced DQ is at the moment.  It's brought me to think that the climb(or supporting financially) isn't worth it at the time being.

** I never said being a duo makes someone a better player.**  If you were diamond and queuing with me, it doesn't make me better.  It just makes me climb into a rank that I don't clearly belong when we're not queuing together.  Not only did you just screw over 5 opponents per game by boosting me, but now you're screwing over 4 other players when I'm a silver in plat game.  Add in DQ and now you have 2 other "plats" struggling in a rank they don't belong.  That's what I have an issue with.  In the old solo/duo system you were always put in tougher competition because the system believe you two know what you're doing.  DQ...not so much.

Anyway it's not a QQ I lost because I've lost plenty of games.  However it's annoying when you have a clear cut booster in a rank that he doesn't belong abusing dynamic queue and ruining the game's integrity(if it has any left that is).

If that doesn't help then its okay.  If your opinion on my post is already set in your mind that it's qq I lost then that's cool.  Hope you have a good day.

People have been doing that forever. That happened way before this season and I doubt it's a common enough occurrence to merit a sweeping change.  I do think its a thing to be addressed but to do so feels like it would be a major undertaking given its rarity.

Instead you could take the single loss to look at how the Yas player beat you and take that lesson into other games, kind of like how a normal loss goes down.

Trust me I've definitely learned a thing or two during that beat down.  From new ward spots to the first time I saw someone do an auto reset a couple seasons ago, I try to implement things I've seen from better players.

Still, while it's good to learn something from a better player, it still doesn't sit well that he will just lose 4 or 5 more games(it's a pattern in history) to keep himself in this rank.  Yes people have boosted since season 1 I do get that.  This season is so much different because of the multiple boosting a person can do now.  I've already seen so many posts about people feeding out of their minds because they are gold 1.  It's an issue that needs to be addressed because rank is more of a joke than ever.  Thanks for your input and opinion.
